description.value:
Trigger A creature enters the room

Effect An illusory wall appears across the room's entrance. A creature who succeeds at @Check[perception|dc:30] check disbelieves the illusion, allowing them to leave the area. The haunt then rolls initiative.

details.description: The voices of the nameless dead intrude into the minds of the living.
details.disable: @Check[perception|dc:26] to discern a name spoken by the nameless dead, or @Check[religion|dc:28] (expert) to put the nameless dead to rest. Speaking three names aloud disables the haunt. A creature that speaks any other name aloud must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:28] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Confused] for 1 round.
details.reset: If the haunt is disabled, divine light washes through the area. Living creatures in the area regain @Damage[4d8[healing]] Hit Points, and undead creatures in the area take @Damage[4d8[vitality]] damage. The haunt deactivates 1 minute after all creatures leave the area but resets immediately thereafter.
details.routine: (1 action; auditory, divine, emotion, fear, mental) Spirits of the dead whisper their names into the minds of creatures in the room, dealing @Damage[(2d10+11)[mental]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[will|dc:28|basic|options:area-effect] save). A creature that fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Frightened]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Frightened]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).
